title.narrative: Indo-Afghan Tech Camp: Capacity Building Programme To Promote Sustainable Urban Development

description.narrative: High rates of urbanization both in rural, India and Afghanistan raises the challenges and opportunities. Weak municipal governance and land management, housing and infrastructure gaps, transportation, sanitation, urban safety and resilience, poverty, social exclusion and gender inequalities, large informal sector, environmental degradation and pollution is among those challenges that is possible to manage. Addressing these challenges through national and sub-national missions and programs, viz. smart cities mission and AMRUT in India and Afghanistan National Development Strategy, National priority program on Local Governance, AfghanistanTech Camps are intended as a knowledge exchange platform for peer to peer learning and capacity building of policymakers, urban planners and practitioners, academia and researchers for developing sustainable solutions for addressing shared urban issues in India and Afghanistan. The program would also include establishing cross-border professional networks among participants, Tech-Camps in Mumbai and Kabul and an online platform for knowledge dissemination and advocacy.
